page.title: 17"Waggon & Horses":Worlds End
page.content: This public house stands on the old A34 Oxford-Newbury road at Beedon. As it stands today it shows many alterations. The pub is converted stables whereas the cottages attached to it used to be the original pub. Inside there is little to show of its historic past - unless you go downstairs to the cellar where some of the original brick and woodwork can be seen. Outside, the old stable-yard has changed into a small car-park and delightful children's garden. The landlord also tells of a ghostly rider who is occaisionally seen at night coming to the pub - his origins are unknown! Standing on the old A34 , this could easily be an old coaching inn near the important crossroads at Newbury, where the London-Bristol road crossed the Oxford-Winchester road.
